channel.title: [PHP] Replace Output?
channel.description:
I'm not sure how to phrase it, but on my website I want to make it before it outputs actually replace all "\n" with "". Something like this (excuse no tabs, i'm doing this entirely in a web browser): [code] A website

This is my website :D

A website

This is my website :D

[/code] Any pointers on this or do I have to make a template system?

item.title: [PHP] Replace Output?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:4, topic:412103”]http://davidwalsh.name/compress-xhtml-page-output-php-output-buffers

Should be what you’re looking for[/quote]
Absolutely sexy, thanks a bunch!

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Replace Output?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

David Walsh Blog – 27 Nov 07

Compress Your XHTML Page Output Using PHP Output Buffers

Us programmers love to keep our code readable and neat, which is why we use hundreds of tabs and line feeds in our code. The problem with doing this in the web programming world is that our users don't care about our neatly indented code. So why...

Should be what you’re looking for

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Replace Output?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

eyeownyew:

It will do that automatically if you don’t use

or
. I don’t think removing lines from the source code matters.

I’d like it so if the viewer views the source, everything is on one line and not entirely organized with the words “STEAL ME STEAL ME” on it (if you know what I mean). I am quite aware that it is really easy to get past this, but it will still give them a hard time, and I like that.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP] Replace Output?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

I’m not sure how to phrase it, but on my website I want to make it before it outputs actually replace all “\n” with “”. Something like this (excuse no tabs, i’m doing this entirely in a web browser):

<html>
<head>
<title>A website</title>
</head>
<body>
<p>This is my website :D</p>
</body>
</html>
<?php
output_replace("\n", ""); //It's obvious this is not the way to do it, but it's an example

And the output would be:

<html><head><title>A website</title></head><body><p>This is my website :D</p></body></html>

Any pointers on this or do I have to make a template system?

Read full topic
